cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP2 ALL
TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM

BULLETIN
Tropical Depression Jova Advisory Number   6
NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL       EP122017
200 AM PDT Sun Aug 13 2017

...JOVA STILL A TROPICAL DEPRESSION...
...EXPECTED TO BECOME A REMNANT LOW LATER TODAY...


SUMMARY OF 200 AM PDT...0900 UTC...INFORMATION
----------------------------------------------
LOCATION...20.4N 116.0W
ABOUT 345 MI...555 KM WNW OF SOCORRO ISLAND
MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...35 MPH...55 KM/H
PRESENT MOVEMENT...W OR 270 DEGREES AT 15 MPH...24 KM/H
MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1005 MB...29.68 INCHES


WATCHES AND WARNINGS
--------------------
There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.


DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK
------------------------------
At 200 AM PDT (0900 UTC), the center of Tropical Depression Jova was
located near latitude 20.4 North, longitude 116.0 West. The
depression is moving toward the west near 15 mph (24 km/h), and this
general motion is expected to continue for the next couple of days
with some decrease in forward speed.

Maximum sustained winds remain near 35 mph (55 km/h) with higher
gusts. However, gradual weakening is expected, and Jova is forecast
to become a remnant low later today.

The estimated minimum central pressure is 1005 mb (29.68 inches).


HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND
----------------------
None


NEXT ADVISORY
-------------
Next complete advisory at 800 AM PDT.

$$
Forecaster Stewart

NNNN
